newsitem.title: FRANCE: Chirac, Jospin firm will for EMU deal by wk end - Kok.
newsitem.headline: Chirac, Jospin firm will for EMU deal by wk end - Kok.

text.p: Dutch Prime Minister Wim Kok said on Tuesday that both French President Jacques Chirac and French Prime Minister Lionel Jospin had shown a "firm will" during talks to find a solution by the end of the week to a dispute over an EU budget stability pact.
Kok, whose country holds the presidency of the European Union, said there was no guarantee of success, but the political will was there.
Dutch Finance Minister Gerrit Zalm was charged with preparing a series of texts to resolve the dispute.
"We have spoken to the French president and prime minister. Both expressed their firm will to participate in finding solutions for this before the end of the week," Kok added.
He said the French government had not put any new proposals on the table on the separate issue of EU institutional reform within the framework of the intergovernmenmtal conference (IGC).

Kok will see German Chancellor Helmut Kohl on Wednesday and Chirac and Jospin will meet Kohl on Friday for intensive talks aimed at resolving the dispute before the Amsterdam EU summit on June 16 and 17.
